recipe.name: Mapo Tofu
recipe.description: A vegan twist on a classic dish

ingredient.name: preserved black beans in chilli oil
cornstarch
ingredient.preparation: as a slurry, mixed with 1-2 tbsp water

step.description: Get a small pot of water up to a boil, and add in ½ tsp of salt. Add enough water so that it’d be able to submerge the tofu around 3 inches.
Lower to a heavy simmer, carefully add in tofu cubes. Simmer for around 3 minutes. Leave tofu cubes in the hot water until you’re ready to cook.
Add your Sichuan peppercorns to a wok and toast for around 1-2 minutes over a medium low flame. You’re done once you can see little oil splotches on the side of your wok.
Slice the green garlic, mince the garlic, mince the ginger, roughly chop the douchi fermented beans, mince the shiitake mushrooms.
Get the seasoning ready: Mix the 1 tbsp light soy sauce, 1 tbsp Shaoxing wine, ¼ tsp MSG, ¼ tsp white pepper powder, ½ tbsp toasted sesame oil in a container and set aside.

Get your wok piping hot, shut off the heat, add in the oil, and give it a swirl to get a nice non-stick surface.
Heat on medium high now, heat the oil up until bubbles start to form around a pair of chopsticks (around 170C).
Drop in the mushrooms. Fry for around four minutes.
Shut off the heat. Add in the chili bean paste, begin to fry. Make sure it’s not burning, then swap the flame back to medium-low.
Fry the chili bean paste for ~90 seconds to color and flavor the oil. Optimal temperature to fry chili bean paste in oil is 100-110C.
Mix in the fermented black beans in chili oil.
Add in the garlic and ginger and mix.
Drain the tofu cubes, then toss them in. Carefully arrange, make sure not to break the tofu.

Swap flame to medium high, get up to heavy simmer.
Simmer everything for ~7 minutes, or until reduced by about one third. While simmering, carefully push the tofu back and forth to prevent sticking.
Add in HALF the slurry. Allow to thicken. If thickened to your liking, proceed to the next step. If not, add in the remainder of the slurry.
Add in the spring onions. Mix and cook for 15 seconds if using scallions.
Sprinkle over the Sichuan peppercorn powder. Heat off, and serve.

recipe.notes: If you don't have shiitake mushrooms, just skip them and just add a bit more of MSG.
